jobs.title: Sales Development Representative German Speaking (m/w/d)
jobs.description:
At some companies you can feel the momentum building. People are engaged, they're approaching their work with energy, enthusiasm and resilience. Being part of the organisation becomes part of your own identity.

We started Peakon to help companies around the world build better workplaces. Where employees know they're listened to, managers learn from their own decisions and develop as leaders, and entire organisations see a step-change in what they can achieve.

Trust and transparency guide everything we do. At Peakon you’ll find a transparent salary model, unlimited vacation, minimal hierarchy, and maximum freedom to develop and execute your own ideas. Our style of collaboration is based on honesty and friendship, and we always love making new friends…


ABOUT YOU:

Half orator, half organiser – you combine inspiring idea pitching skills with the organisational obsession of someone who alphabetises their vinyl collection. You’ll perform a vital role within our sales team developing inbound and outbound leads – via demo requests, emails, and phone calls – into qualified opportunities for our account executives.

This is an ideal role for an articulate, determined, and customer-focused individual who is passionate about starting a career in sales and business development at a fast-growing startup.



RESPONSIBILITIES:

*Drive Peakon’s revenue growth through outreach via phone, email, and demo requests -you'll be mapping companies and always make sure you find the right person to speak to.
*Set up appointments for the sales team, and meet a weekly goal of outbound meetings set.
*Cultivate and qualify new inbound leads that turn into quality meetings.
*Understand and succinctly communicate the Peakon value proposition.

REQUIREMENTS
*A perfect command of English, with fluent German to a level you'll be comfortable pitching Peakon to execs!
*Familiarity with (or willingness to learn) CRM tools such as Salesforce.
*Sales experience preferred but not essential.
*Comfortable conversing about management techniques, web technologies, and basic statistics (correlation, regression, distributions, etc.).
*Proactive mindset and upbeat personality, with strong organisational skills.

BENEFITS
*Unlimited holiday
*Lunch every Friday
*Flexible working
*Company wide trips
*Choice of hardware
*Flexible travel policy

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.description:
At some companies, you can feel the momentum building. People are engaged, they're approaching their work with energy, enthusiasm and resilience. Being part of the organisation becomes part of your own identity.

At others, it feels impossible to get everyone pulling in the same direction. People lose sight of the company's purpose, they start looking out only for themselves – or elsewhere for new opportunities.

We started Peakon to help companies around the world build better workplaces. Where employees know they're listened to, managers learn from their own decisions and develop as leaders, and entire organisations see a step-change in what they can achieve.

Trust and transparency guide everything we do. At Peakon you’ll find a transparent salary model, unlimited vacation, minimal hierarchy, and maximum freedom to develop and execute your own ideas. Our style of collaboration is based on honesty and friendship, and we always love making new friends…



ABOUT YOU:

You have a strong successful track-record in SaaS product management. You have a strong technical foundation and keep on top of new developments in the field. You have extensive practical experience working as product manager and can easily translate customer needs into engineering requirements.

You are probably doing a great job at your current position but looking for an opportunity to work on a product impacting the life of thousands of employees around the world.



RESPONSIBILITIES:

At Peakon, product is the foundation of everything we do. Our mission is to deliver the insights that help everyone in an organisation reach their full potential.

You will work on the Peakon product throughout the lifecycle. Your core tasks will include:

Working closely with engineering, design, sales and customer success teams to collect and prioritize product inputs
Conducting user interviews and market research
Problem definition and solution design and validation
Epics, stories and documentation for product development
Define and track KPIs and metrics to measure results
Managing product roadmap, including pricing, new features, segmentation etc
Contributing to the overall product strategy


REQUIREMENTS
Strong academic record and project management skills
A minimum of 2-3 years experience with product management in an international SaaS company
Ideally ex-founder of your own startup (successful or otherwise!)
Proven experience translating customer needs into engineering requirements
Ability to conceptualize, manage, and prioritize multiple projects
Proven track record of taking ownership and driving results
A good presenter who is able to communicate to people of varied technical ability
Experience facing customers and understanding the root cause of product inputs


BENEFITS
Unlimited holiday
Subsidised lunch everyday
Flexible working
Company wide trips
Flexible travel policy
Pension

jobs.title: Account Executive - Swedish speaking
jobs.description:
DESCRIPTION
At some companies you can feel the momentum building. People are engaged, they're approaching their work with energy, enthusiasm and resilience. Being part of the organisation becomes part of your own identity.

At others, it feels impossible to get everyone pulling in the same direction. People lose sight of the company's purpose, they start looking out only for themselves – or elsewhere for new opportunities.

We started Peakon to help companies around the world build better workplaces. Where employees know they're listened to, managers learn from their own decisions and develop as leaders, and entire organisations see a step-change in what they can achieve.

Trust and transparency guide everything we do. At Peakon you’ll find a transparent salary model, unlimited vacation, minimal hierarchy, and maximum freedom to develop and execute your own ideas. Our style of collaboration is based on honesty and friendship, and we always love making new friends…



ABOUT YOU:

You believe that organisations should be run differently than they are today. You want to be a part of a team that collaborates and works very hard to realise a vision of a new way of working. You want to relay that vision to every other organisation out there.

You are not afraid of asking for the deal while at the same time understanding the importance of delivering real long-term client value. You’ll love solving customers problems as much as closing deals. Your level of ambition and determination will be off the scale, and you’ll relish the opportunity to be a crucial part of a team that will take Peakon and your career into hyperspace.



RESPONSIBILITIES:

Close a quota of deals per month based on meetings provided to you by a sales development rep.
Own the development of the Swedish market in these early stages.
Have an ability - and desire - to understand customers problems and sell solutions that solve those problems.
Be ruthlessly efficient at drilling into deal blockers and disqualifying leads that are a bad fit.
Take feedback from customers and funnel it into the product development process.
Construct, forecast, and manage your sales pipeline via Salesforce CRM.
Help us define the sales strategy and build the sales organisation.

REQUIREMENTS
Proven tech/startup sales experience, ideally in SaaS for mid-market companies.
Proven track record of building a client base and consistently exceeding revenue targets and company goals.
Ability to communicate with C-level or equivalent professionals.
Must be fluent in Swedish & English
Ability to identify customer problems and propose comprehensive solutions for their needs.
Comfortable conversing about management techniques and basic statistics (correlation, regression, distributions, etc.).
Strong use of insights and data-driven decision making to inform the sales process.
Ability to solve problems, adapt, and grow quickly as we build the sales organisation.
Extremely proactive and upbeat with strong organisational skills.
Strong technical understanding and excellent presentation skills

jobs.title: Mobile Engineer (Android)
jobs.description:
At some companies you can feel the momentum building. People are engaged, they're approaching their work with energy, enthusiasm and resilience. Being part of the organisation becomes part of your own identity.

At others, it feels impossible to get everyone pulling in the same direction. People lose sight of the company's purpose, they start looking out only for themselves – or elsewhere for new opportunities.

We started Peakon to help companies around the world build better workplaces. Where employees know they're listened to, managers learn from their own decisions and develop as leaders, and entire organisations see a step-change in what they can achieve.

Trust and transparency guide everything we do. At Peakon you’ll find a transparent salary model, unlimited vacation, minimal hierarchy, and maximum freedom to develop and execute your own ideas. Our style of collaboration is based on honesty and friendship, and we always love making new friends…


ABOUT YOU:

You are an engineer at heart, with a deep technical understanding of native app development on Android. You stay up to date on the latest news and technology trends and keep yourself informed about current best practices in mobile app development.

You have experience in building, shipping and maintaining native apps for the Android platform.You are looking to join a small and productive product team where you can have a big impact in the company and for customers.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

At Peakon, we value great a customer experience on both desktop and mobile. Since the beginning of Peakon, having a responsive mobile web experience has been a top priority to us. Now, we are looking for a Mobile App Engineer with deep knowledge of native app development on Android, to help us take our mobile experience to the next level by enhancing existing and new products with native app capabilities.

At Peakon, we rely heavily on JavaScript at every level of our technology stack, and React in particular for our user experience on the web. Our ambition is to push the boundaries of the type of user experiences and developer workflows made possible by blending web and native technologies.

As a Mobile App Engineer at Peakon, you will be bringing native app expertise to a team developing new mobile products, primarily for line managers using Peakon daily to improve their team’s happiness, productivity and engagement. You will work closely with our experienced JavaScript and React developers to build world class mobile experiences for our customers.


Requirements

Our ideal candidate has…

* +2 years experience working as a mobile app engineer in an agile team
* Experience in developing, shipping and maintaining a native app for the Android platform
* Some experience with web technologies like JavaScript
* Some knowledge of React Native and its capabilities, or experience working with other cross-platform frameworks for native app development
* Some experience or interest in working with modern JavaScript technologies
* Detail-oriented, focusing on writing maintainable code of high quality
* Experience in using automated testing

We welcome your application even if you do not meet all of the criteria listed above, but are excited about the challenge of mastering this role. We know that skills are not static and growth is continuous, so we are excited to help you take your career to the next level at Peakon.


THE TECH:

We make it a priority to stay on the cutting edge of tech. We are highly motivated by learning and growing in our roles, and constantly evolving is a key part of that.

The tech stack of Peakon centers around Javascript, with Node.js on the server and React on the frontend. We believe there is great value in a shared toolchain across the stack, enabling engineers to work on all parts of the system. Some tasks are better solved with different tools, and thus we use f.ex. Python for the data science parts of the system.

We are big fans of new JavaScript language features like async/await, and have made it a priority to stay up to date with the latest versions of Node. We are primarily hosted on Heroku and AWS, with an increasing number of our services moving to the latter. We use PostgreSQL (through RDS), Redis and ElasticSearch for storage.

We rely heavily on automated testing on all levels of the application, with thousands of tests checking every commit to our code base. We use CircleCI for hosted continuous integration to make sure our most recent changes are always available to test, and we deploy code to our production environment on a daily basis.


Benefits

* Unlimited holiday
* Subsidised lunch everyday
* Flexible working
* Company wide trips
* Choice of hardware
* Flexible travel policy
* Pension

jobs.title: Sales Engineer
jobs.description:
WHO WE ARE

We’re a team driven by the belief that we can radically change the world of work. We believe – and hear from our customers every day – that when an organisation understands itself better it can create more fulfilling jobs, and grow in ways never before imagined.

Enterprises big and small trust our products to provide visibility and clarity in areas once characterised by hearsay and uncertainty. With the insights delivered by Peakon, these organisations become more agile, responsive, and able to make the changes and investments that their employees care about most.

We’re in the business of creating great places to work, so it should be no surprise that this is our highest priority at Peakon. With ambitions as big as ours, we see individual growth and development as the key strategy for growing our business.

Trust and transparency guide everything we do here. You’ll find an open salary model, unlimited vacation, minimal hierarchy, and maximum freedom to develop and execute your own ideas. Our style of collaboration is based on honesty and friendship, and we always love making new friends...


RESPONSIBILITIES

As the Peakon Sales team grows, we are looking for a Sales Engineer to take on the responsibility of being the liason between our engineering team, sales team and prospects to ensure customer needs are satisfied in regards to Information Security, data integration and data privacy. You will be supporting the engineering team with security guidance and help provide training to make sure security is top of mind in every aspect of the daily work.

You will explain to customers how Peakon meets both technical stakeholders and end-user employee requirements of technical security and privacy, all while using personal skills to ensure our customers trust that we are keeping our data secure and private but not influencing the systems themselves. Our customers trust us to keep their data safe, and as Peakon grows, their trust will continue to be a top priority for the business and this role.

Additionally, you will work with customers to both convey our external efforts to detect vulnerabilities and deter threats, as well as coordinate with customers to run their own bespoke testing.

You will spend significant time supporting the rest of the business on security-related matters, and work closely with our legal and sales teams in making sure our customers trust us at every point of their journey with Peakon.


WHO YOU ARE

2-4 years of Sales Engineering Experience

You are an engineer at heart, with a deep technical understanding of Information Technology and IT as well as web applications. You stay up to date on the latest news and technology trends as well as changing Data Regulations like GDPR and the latest developments in Californian and US privacy law, all while keeping yourself informed about current security best practices.

You have a mix of Sales, Engineering and Security experience, perhaps working as a security engineer at a medium- or large-size company. You are looking to join a smaller team where you can have a big impact in the company and for customers.

You are self-organizing, process-oriented and able to work independently to complete tasks and projects. You are a great communicator, used to interacting with many different parts of a business.

You are a great communicator who is equally comfortable talking and writing about large data sets with IT stakeholders, as well as making the complex sound simple when communicating with business stakeholders.

Requirements

* Desire to improve the world of work
* Passion for technology, data science algorithms, statistics, cloud security & infrastructure and GDPR along with the ability to explain those complex topics in an easy way to our customers
* Customer focus and experience dealing with external stakeholders
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including presentations and documentation for our customers and sales teams
* Organisation and attention to detail
* Fast learner with a proactive approach to work
* Experience working in a fast-paced startup environment is a plus
* Experience with Salesforce and Microsoft Office / Google suite, with particular focus on Excel / Sheets

Benefits

* Unlimited holiday
* Lunch every Wednesday
* Flexible working
* Company wide trips
* Choice of hardware
* Flexible travel policy
* Pension

jobs.title: Marketing Operations Manager
jobs.description:
Description
At some companies you can feel the momentum building. People are engaged, they're approaching their work with energy, enthusiasm and resilience. Being part of the organisation becomes part of your own identity.

At others, it feels impossible to get everyone pulling in the same direction. People lose sight of the company's purpose, they start looking out only for themselves – or elsewhere for new opportunities.

We started Peakon to help companies around the world build better workplaces. Where employees know they're listened to, managers learn from their own decisions and develop as leaders, and entire organisations see a step-change in what they can achieve.

Trust and transparency guide everything we do. At Peakon you’ll find a transparent salary model, unlimited vacation, minimal hierarchy, and maximum freedom to develop and execute your own ideas. Our style of collaboration is based on honesty and friendship, and we always love making new friends.



Who you are

We’re on the hunt for the fifth member to join Peakon’s Revenue Operations team. Over the last few years we have been busy building the rails for the marketing, sales and customer success functions to run along, reducing friction by continually putting our tools, processes and data under the microscope.

We’re now looking for someone to take ownership of Peakon’s ‘top of funnel’ infrastructure, a role we’re affectionately naming Marketing Operations. You’ll reinforce the bridge between marketing and sales, ensuring a seamless experience for our prospects and colleagues. This means ensuring any barriers during customer acquisition are identified and removed, and using data-driven insights to inform the wider business what’s working well, and where we can improve.

You will help build processes from the ground up, share responsibility for the integrity of our data and take ownership of Peakon’s lead acquisition tools. You’ll help drive operational excellence into Peakon’s sales and marketing org by defining best practice, identifying and leading process improvements. Thinking like a computer will only get you so far, the main part of this role requires a human touch! Your responsibilities will require close liaison with members of the global Marketing and Sales teams, at all levels.

We aren't looking for someone to simply manage marketing operations, but someone who will champion it. You’ll gather requirements from across the business, provide training, present your ideas and identify opportunities for cost and operational efficiencies. All of this will help us learn and improve as we continue to grow.

You’ll be working with a variety of stakeholders on an ever-evolving set of projects, no two days are the same. Ideally, you have experience optimising internal processes and workflows. You’ll be working as a key member of the Revenue Operations team. We triage as a group, bounce ideas around and support each other on the technical side to build solutions that scale with Peakon.

If you like creative problem solving, making data-driven decisions, and get a kick out of making other people’s working lives easier, we want to hear from you.



Our ideal candidate...

Analytically minded with a dash of scrutiny, eager to learn, and motivated.

Description
At some companies you can feel the momentum building. People are engaged, they're approaching their work with energy, enthusiasm and resilience. Being part of the organisation becomes part of your own identity.

At others, it feels impossible to get everyone pulling in the same direction. People lose sight of the company's purpose, they start looking out only for themselves – or elsewhere for new opportunities.

We started Peakon to help companies around the world build better workplaces. Where employees know they're listened to, managers learn from their own decisions and develop as leaders, and entire organisations see a step-change in what they can achieve.

Trust and transparency guide everything we do. At Peakon you’ll find a transparent salary model, unlimited vacation, minimal hierarchy, and maximum freedom to develop and execute your own ideas. Our style of collaboration is based on honesty and friendship, and we always love making new friends.

Who you are

We’re on the hunt for the fifth member to join Peakon’s Revenue Operations team. Over the last few years we have been busy building the rails for the marketing, sales and customer success functions to run along, reducing friction by continually putting our tools, processes and data under the microscope.

We’re now looking for someone to take ownership of Peakon’s ‘top of funnel’ infrastructure, a role we’re affectionately naming Marketing Operations. You’ll reinforce the bridge between marketing and sales, ensuring a seamless experience for our prospects and colleagues. This means ensuring any barriers during customer acquisition are identified and removed, and using data-driven insights to inform the wider business what’s working well, and where we can improve.

You will help build processes from the ground up, share responsibility for the integrity of our data and take ownership of Peakon’s lead acquisition tools. You’ll help drive operational excellence into Peakon’s sales and marketing org by defining best practice, identifying and leading process improvements. Thinking like a computer will only get you so far, the main part of this role requires a human touch! Your responsibilities will require close liaison with members of the global Marketing and Sales teams, at all levels.

We aren't looking for someone to simply manage marketing operations, but someone who will champion it. You’ll gather requirements from across the business, provide training, present your ideas and identify opportunities for cost and operational efficiencies. All of this will help us learn and improve as we continue to grow.

You’ll be working with a variety of stakeholders on an ever-evolving set of projects, no two days are the same. Ideally, you have experience optimising internal processes and workflows. You’ll be working as a key member of the Revenue Operations team. We triage as a group, bounce ideas around and support each other on the technical side to build solutions that scale with Peakon.

If you like creative problem solving, making data-driven decisions, and get a kick out of making other people’s working lives easier, we want to hear from you.
